scenario_text.value:
Takuma... I’m sorry about before. I didn’t
mean to throw Aoi under the bus.

That’s okay. Given the situation, I can see
how you were being realistic.

Even so, in light of all the friends you’ve
lost, it was a cruel thing to say.
I regret bringing it up.

Akiharu, you need not apologize. I’m the
reason she’s missing in the first place.
Renamon...

Didn’t we tell you not to blame yourself for
that?

Everyone understands that you were only
trying to do all you could to save Miyuki.
Yeah, the professor’s right.

Still, I was willing to sever the bonds
between you so long as I got Miyuki back.
I was being selfish.

I was willing to make that trade, even though
I knew how much Miyuki’s bond meant to me.

(Renamon seemed so calm and collected when we
were all talking just now.)

(He must be feeling a lot more responsible
for what happened to Aoi than I realized.)

(Is there anything I could say that might
help him feel better?)

(I mean, I doubt he’ll accept that this
wasn’t his fault if I just tell him that.)

(Should I use his sense of responsibility to
get him fired up for the search?)

(But if I do that, it might end up putting
too much pressure on Renamon.)

(Maybe the thing to do is point out that this
is why we all need to work together?)
(How can I cheer Renamon up?)
Say he’s not to blame.
Get him to search.
Emphasize cooperation.
Say he’s not to blame.

Renamon, it’s not like everything that
happened was your sole responsibility.

That’s all you people ever say, but it was
still my illusions that started everything.
How can I not be responsible for that?

Regardless of what you did, we all knew Aoi
was struggling with Saki’s death.

And despite that, none of us kept an eye on
her.

So if we’re assigning blame for what happened
there, I’d say we all deserve some of it.

Including me... I didn’t notice at all when
I stopped sensing Aoi.

Well, you were fighting. I wouldn’t be too
hard on yourself.

Still, I don’t feel like I can say I didn’t
do anything wrong.

Right, that’s how I feel too. Only I don’t
think it’s very helpful to focus on that.

So, Renamon, why don’t we move on from
worrying about who’s to blame?
Get him to search.

Well, if you really feel bad about what
happened, don’t cry about it. Go find Aoi.

Takuma, don’t you think that’s putting things
a little harshly?
I realize it’s not a nice thing to say.

But right now we need to find Aoi. Doing that
will help us save Miyuki, too.

Isn’t that what you said to us yourself,
Renamon?
True...

Then there’s no time for wallowing in self-
doubt.
You’re saying...this is my penance?
Emphasize cooperation.

Look, nobody cares whose fault this is. The
important thing is that we find Aoi.

So what we need to do right now is focus on
working together to look for her.
And you’ll all be satisfied with that?

Of course. After all, you’re one of us,
Renamon.
That’s just how I feel too!

And when one of us is in trouble, the others
all help out. It’s what we did for you.
Now it’s your turn to help Aoi!
Yes. You may both have a point there.

Really, the important thing is that we find
Aoi.

Though of course we should also keep in mind
what comes next.
What do you mean?

I mean we’ll need to figure out how to help
Miyuki, er, my sister, and bring her back.
I think we’ll need Aoi for that.

Yes... I think you’re right. In which case,
we can’t afford to stand around, can we?
Huh? Renamon? Where are you going?
To look for Aoi, obviously.
He just...went off on his own.

Maybe he’s still not comfortable being around
us.

Perhaps not. As he is now, however, he’s
likely quite safe on his own.

Renamon may have gone off looking for Aoi on
his own,
but I doubt we need to worry about him.
